dt: {bc}money or other liquid resources of a government, business, group, or individual

dt.t: The library closed due to a lack of {wi}finances{/wi}.

dt: {bc}the system that includes the circulation of money, the granting of credit, the making of investments, and the provision of banking facilities
{bc}the science or study of the management of funds

dt.t: An expert in {wi}finance{/wi} predicts a global recession.
business expansion for which {wi}finance{/wi} would otherwise be unavailable

et: borrowed from French {it}finances,{/it} going back to Middle French, "monetary resources, revenue," in singular, "money, resource," from {it}finer{/it} "to pay by way of settlement, make a payment" (derivative of {it}fin{/it} "final agreement, payment, {et_link|fine:3|fine:3}") + {it}-ance{/it} {et_link|-ance|-ance}

In the current senses, {it}finance{/it} is borrowed directly from French, though the word existed in English with early senses going back to medieval French; cf. Middle English {it}fynaunce{/it} "ending, outcome, monetary payment, ransom," borrowed from Anglo-French in these senses.
shortdef: money or other liquid resources of a government, business, group, or individual
the system that includes the circulation of money, the granting of credit, the making of investments, and the provision of banking facilities
the science or study of the management of funds

dt: {bc}to raise or provide funds or capital for

shortdef: to raise or provide funds or capital for
to sell something to on credit

dt: {bc}to join one or more others in providing money or funds for (something) {bc}to {d_link|finance|finance:2} (something) jointly

dt.t: Last month, the studio announced that two Chinese media companies … had agreed to {wi}co-finance{/wi} the studio's movies for the next three years.

shortdef: to join one or more others in providing money or funds for (something) : to finance (something) jointly

dt.t: The executive pension plan is not {wi}pre-financed{/wi}; the money is not set aside in advance and the costs are instead paid from annual cash flow as a compensation expense.

dt: {bc}to raise or provide funds or capital for (something) oneself {bc}to {d_link|finance|finance:2} (something) oneself

dt.t: Sherzan {wi}self-financed{/wi} much of his primary campaign, putting in more than $640,000 of his own money.

dt: {bc}to furnish or provide oneself with necessary funds or capital

dt.t: They lack the resources to {wi}self-finance{/wi} until they have built a big enough operation.

shortdef: to raise or provide funds or capital for (something) oneself : to finance (something) oneself
to furnish or provide oneself with necessary funds or capital
